meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound, typically made by a bell or gong.
meanings.sent1: The klong of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I heard the klong of the gong during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The klong of the bell startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The klong of the gong filled the room with music.
meanings.sent5: The klong of the bell was so loud it could be heard from miles away.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: He likes to klong the metal pot with a spoon.
meanings.sent2: The metal pipe klonged loudly when struck.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally klonged the door shut with a bang.
meanings.sent4: The hammer klonged against the anvil in the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The drumsticks klonged against the drum, creating a rhythmic beat.

meanings.definition: A deep, resonant sound, typically made by a large metal object striking another object.
meanings.sent1: The klong of the metal door closing reverberated in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The klong of the hammer hitting the metal echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected klong of the metal pipe startled the workers.
meanings.sent4: The klong of the metal gate closing signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The klong of the metal bellows added a deep tone to the music performance.
